triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: Large language models serve as the core computational foundation enabling generative agents to understand and generate natural language behavior.

triples.name: The Sims
triples.relevance: The Sims provides the conceptual inspiration and design pattern for the interactive sandbox environment where generative agents are instantiated.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: Natural language processing enables agents to communicate with end users and store/retrieve memories in human-readable text format.

triples.name: Software agent
triples.relevance: The paper extends the software agent concept with generative capabilities, memory, and realistic behavioral simulation powered by language models.

triples.name: Agent-based model
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates agent-based modeling applied to human behavior simulation with emergent social interactions and complex planning.

triples.name: Memory
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel memory architecture that stores agent experiences in natural language and synthesizes them into higher-level reflections.

triples.name: Self-reflection
triples.relevance: Self-reflection mechanisms enable agents to process and learn from past experiences to inform future decision-making and behavior planning.
